title: Wagner Chief Says Bakhmut Is Taken; Ukraine Rejects Claim
description: The head of the Russian paramilitary group said his forces had captured the eastern city, a claim Ukrainian officials were quick to deny even as they called the situation “critical.”

title: Battle for Bakhmut: Key Events in Russia-Ukraine War’s Longest Fight
description: The city has for months been the center of the fighting in the Donbas region of eastern Ukraine. Here’s a look at the critical moments.

title: Bakhmut Exposes Feud Between Russian Officials and Wagner’s Prigozhin
description: Yevgeny V. Prigozhin, once a caterer for the Kremlin, has made capturing the city a personal obsession.

title: In Flood-Stricken Area of Italy, Residents Fear This Won’t Be the Last of It
description: Flooding upended tens of thousands of lives this week in Emilia-Romagna, a region that has also experienced drought in recent years.

title: The Cannes Film Festival
description: Among the films premiering are features from Martin Scorsese, Wes Anderson and Todd Haynes.

title: Alberta Fires Rage While Election Ignores Global Warming
description: For politicians, discussing climate change in a province enriched by oil money is fraught.

title: At G7 Summit, Leaders Wrangle on Coal, Natural Gas and Climate
description: The U.S. finds itself caught between defending President Biden’s climate change agenda and aiding allies intent on increasing their access to fossil fuels.

title: Zelensky Lands in Japan for G7 Summit, Seeking Military Aid
description: He landed on Saturday and was expected to address world leaders on Sunday, strengthened by a U.S. move to let Ukrainian pilots train on the American-made F-16 fighter jets.

title: Building Boom on Mykonos Reveals ‘Wretched’ Side of Greece’s Recovery
description: Investors are eager to cash in on soaring demand for luxury properties, but an attack on an archaeologist investigating building violations brought a darker underbelly to light.

title: How Ukraine Reversed the Momentum in Bakhmut
description: Seizing an opening as Russia rotated troops, Ukraine pressed ahead with three days of maneuvers that gained ground on the flanks of Bakhmut.

title: Biden and G7 Summit Partners Struggle for Support Back Home
description: The relatively weak approval ratings for President Biden and his Group of 7 partners highlight the fragility of free societies facing deep political divides.

title: Zelensky Is Going to Japan for the G7 Summit
description: The Ukrainian president is trying to secure more military aid as Kyiv prepares for a counteroffensive against Russia.
